devdoc.details: This contract uses address-based compatibility functions from EVVMCoreAll payment amounts are encrypted using FHE (Fully Homomorphic Encryption)

OwnableInvalidOwner(address).details: The owner is not a valid owner account. (eg. `address(0)`)

OwnableUnauthorizedAccount(address).details: The caller account is not authorized to perform an operation.

params.client: Address of the client who ordered
params.evvmNonce: Nonce used in the EVVM transaction

params._evvmAddress: Address of the deployed EVVMCore contract
params._ownerOfShop: Address of the shop owner (can withdraw funds)

getClientBalance(address).details: Frontend must decrypt this using cofhesdkClient.decryptHandle()

getShopBalance().details: Frontend must decrypt this using cofhesdkClient.decryptHandle()

returns._0: used True if the nonce has been used
registered True if the shop is registered

orderCoffee(address,string,uint256,uint2.details: The client must call EVVMCore.requestPay() first from the frontend, then call this function with the txIdThis function verifies that the payment was successful by checking:      - The transaction exists      - The transaction is from the client to the shop      - The nonce matches (proving the payment consumed the expected nonce)      - The client's current nonce is expectedNonce + 1 (proving payment was processed)

params.clientAddress: Address of the client placing the order
params.expectedNonce: The nonce that was used in the payment transaction
params.nonce: Service-level nonce to prevent replay attacks
params.paymentTxId: Transaction ID from EVVMCore.requestPay() that was called separately

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

registerShopInEVVM(bytes32,bytes).details: This function should be called during setup to register the shop's address in EVVMThe shop address will be automatically mapped to a vaddrLogic:   1. Check if shop address is already mapped to a vaddr in EVVMCore   2. If mapped, verify the account exists - if yes, revert with ShopAlreadyRegistered   3. If not mapped, generate the vaddr deterministically and check if account exists   4. If account exists via generated vaddr, revert with ShopAlreadyRegistered   5. Otherwise, call registerAccountFromAddress to register the shop

params.initialBalance: External encrypted handle for the initial balance (usually zero)
params.inputProof: ZK proof validating the encrypted input

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

withdrawFunds(address,bytes32,bytes).details: Only the shop owner can call this function

params.amountEnc: External encrypted handle for the amount to withdraw
params.inputProof: ZK proof validating the encrypted input
params.to: Address to receive the funds (must be registered in EVVM)

coffeePrices.details: In a production system, prices could also be encrypted

usedNonces.details: Prevents replay attacks on service-level operations

devdoc.title: EVVMCafe - Coffee Shop Example on EVVM with FHE

ShopAlreadyRegistered().notice: Error thrown when shop is already registered

CoffeeOrdered(address,string,uint256,uin.notice: Emitted when a coffee order is placed

FundsWithdrawn(address,bytes32).notice: Emitted when funds are withdrawn from the shop

coffeePrices(string).notice: Coffee prices (in plaintext for simplicity, could be encrypted)

evvmCore().notice: Reference to the EVVM Core contract

getClientBalance(address).notice: Returns the encrypted balance of a client

getCoffeePrice(string).notice: Gets the price of a coffee type

getShopBalance().notice: Returns the encrypted balance of the coffee shop

isNonceUsed(address,uint256).notice: Checks if a service nonce has been used

isShopRegistered().notice: Checks if the shop is registered in EVVM

orderCoffee(address,string,uint256,uint2.notice: Places a coffee order after payment has been made via EVVMCore

ownerOfShop().notice: Owner of the coffee shop (can withdraw funds)

registerShopInEVVM(bytes32,bytes).notice: Registers the shop in EVVM Core (must be called before first order)

setCoffeePrice(string,uint256).notice: Sets the price of a coffee type (owner only)

setShopOwner(address).notice: Updates the shop owner address (owner only)

withdrawFunds(address,bytes32,bytes).notice: Withdraws encrypted funds from the shop to the owner

userdoc.notice: Example contract demonstrating integration with EVVM Core using encrypted paymentsMigrated from Fhenix CoFHE to Zama FHEVM
